scd-basics.title: What is Sickle Cell Disease?
scd-basics.description: Understanding the basics of SCD, genetics, and types
scd-basics.content:
Sickle Cell Disease (SCD) is a group of inherited red blood cell disorders. In SCD, red blood cells become hard and sticky and look like a C-shaped farm tool called a "sickle."

Key Facts:
â€¢ SCD affects millions of people worldwide
â€¢ It's passed down through families (genetic)
â€¢ Red blood cells become sickle-shaped and can block blood flow
â€¢ This causes pain and organ damage over time

Types of SCD:
â€¢ HbSS (Sickle Cell Anemia) - most common and severe
â€¢ HbSC - generally milder than HbSS
â€¢ HbS beta thalassemia - varies in severity

Understanding your specific type helps you and your healthcare team manage your condition better.

pain-crisis.title: Understanding Pain Crisis
pain-crisis.description: What causes pain crisis and early warning signs
pain-crisis.content:
A pain crisis (vaso-occlusive crisis) happens when sickle-shaped cells block blood flow to parts of the body.

Common Triggers:
â€¢ Dehydration
â€¢ Extreme temperatures (hot or cold)
â€¢ Stress (physical or emotional)
â€¢ Infections
â€¢ High altitudes
â€¢ Overexertion

Warning Signs:
â€¢ Increasing fatigue
â€¢ Mild pain that worsens
â€¢ Difficulty concentrating
â€¢ Fever or feeling unwell

Early Action Steps:
1. Increase fluid intake
2. Rest and avoid triggers
3. Take prescribed pain medication
4. Contact your healthcare team
5. Monitor symptoms closely

Remember: Early intervention can prevent a full crisis.

hydration-guide.title: Staying Hydrated
hydration-guide.description: Why hydration is crucial and how to maintain it
hydration-guide.content:
Proper hydration is one of the most important things you can do to prevent pain crises.

Why Hydration Matters:
â€¢ Keeps blood flowing smoothly
â€¢ Prevents red blood cells from sickling
â€¢ Helps prevent pain crises
â€¢ Supports kidney function
â€¢ Maintains energy levels

Daily Hydration Goals:
â€¢ At least 8-10 glasses (2-2.5 litres) per day
â€¢ More during hot weather or exercise
â€¢ Increase intake when feeling unwell

Best Hydration Sources:
â€¢ Water (best choice)
â€¢ Tea
â€¢ Diluted fruit juices
â€¢ Water-rich foods (watermelon, oranges)

Signs You Need More Fluids:
â€¢ Dark yellow urine
â€¢ Feeling thirsty
â€¢ Fatigue
â€¢ Dizziness
â€¢ Dry mouth

Tip: Set hydration reminders on your phone!

medication-adherence.title: Taking Your Medications
medication-adherence.description: Importance of medication adherence and tips for success
medication-adherence.content:
Taking medications as prescribed is crucial for managing SCD effectively.

Common SCD Medications:
â€¢ Hydroxyurea - reduces pain crises and complications
â€¢ Folic acid - supports red blood cell production
â€¢ Pain medications - for crisis management
â€¢ Antibiotics - for infection prevention

Tips for Medication Success:
1. Set daily reminders
2. Use a pill organizer
3. Keep medications visible
4. Understand what each medication does
5. Never stop without consulting your doctor

Managing Side Effects:
â€¢ Report any new symptoms to your doctor
â€¢ Keep a symptom diary
â€¢ Don't adjust doses on your own
â€¢ Ask about alternatives if needed

Remember: Consistency is key to preventing complications.

exercise-scd.title: Safe Exercise with SCD
exercise-scd.description: How to stay active while managing your condition
exercise-scd.content:
Regular, moderate exercise can benefit people with SCD when done safely.

Benefits of Exercise:
â€¢ Improves circulation
â€¢ Strengthens heart and lungs
â€¢ Reduces stress
â€¢ Maintains healthy weight
â€¢ Improves mood and sleep

Safe Exercise Guidelines:
â€¢ Start slowly and build gradually
â€¢ Stay well-hydrated before, during, and after
â€¢ Avoid extreme temperatures
â€¢ Listen to your body
â€¢ Stop if you feel pain or fatigue

Recommended Activities:
â€¢ Walking
â€¢ Yoga
â€¢ Light cycling
â€¢ Stretching exercises

Warning Signs to Stop:
â€¢ Unusual fatigue
â€¢ Shortness of breath
â€¢ Chest pain
â€¢ Dizziness
â€¢ Any pain crisis symptoms

Always consult your healthcare team before starting a new exercise program.

mental-health.title: Mental Health & SCD
mental-health.description: Managing the emotional aspects of living with SCD
mental-health.content:
Living with a chronic condition like SCD can affect your mental health. This is normal and manageable.

Common Feelings:
â€¢ Anxiety about pain crises
â€¢ Frustration with limitations
â€¢ Sadness or depression
â€¢ Stress about the future
â€¢ Feeling different from others

Healthy Coping Strategies:
â€¢ Connect with other people with SCD
â€¢ Practice relaxation techniques
â€¢ Maintain social connections
â€¢ Pursue hobbies you enjoy
â€¢ Set realistic goals

When to Seek Help:
â€¢ Persistent sadness or anxiety
â€¢ Loss of interest in activities
â€¢ Sleep problems
â€¢ Difficulty concentrating
â€¢ Thoughts of self-harm

Resources for Support:
â€¢ SCD support groups
â€¢ Mental health counselors
â€¢ Online communities
â€¢ Family and friends
â€¢ Healthcare team

Remember: Taking care of your mental health is just as important as managing your physical symptoms.
